ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Some creative writing chops and ways of thinking about the craft of writing.
This course helped push me to write in new mediums and learn how to workshop my writing, and that of my peers.

My writing style really improved from this course. I learned how to write more engaging descriptions and gained insight into the process of writing poetry, something I'd never attempted in an academic setting before this course. Overall, I walked away with a greater appreciation for the process of creative writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: More writing and more workshops! We spent too much time talking about professional examples and not enough time learning how to improve our own work. Also more accountability for doing revisions! A lot of people just left it all for the end, and it would be better for our learning if we had multiple rounds throughout the semester. Of course, this was up to us, but a little formal encouragement would help.

I really appreciated the mix of workshops, guest lecturers, and class discussions in this course. It made the course feel constantly new and exciting, and allowed our class to really get to know each other in a supportive way.
Very well organized and Prof. Deming clearly knows SO much about writing and also how to teach it.

Strengths: Clear expectations and a varied curriculum. I liked the mix of guest speakers, workshops, class discussions, and activity-based lessons. I also think that the final project structure was really smart--I learned a lot from revising my work

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're new to creative writing and want to try it out, yes!
I would recommend it to anyone who is willing to put in the effort. I would recommend against taking it if you are just looking for a fun creative class to take.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who is wanting to dedicate time to writing. The course pushes you to potentially try a new medium and do so in a supportive environment where you learn how to workshop your peers' work. The guest lecturers and professors are all incredibly inspiring and I left the semester with excitement to continue writing more.
Yes! You get to learn prose, poetry, and drama, and you get good feedback and read exemplary texts for all of them.
Yes! My writing really improved and I loved the seminar style of the course. The class meshed well, and it was fun to hear everyone's writing develop.
